metadata.chief_complaint: sore throat, rapid strep positive, multiple orders needed

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hi, the nurse told me Lily's rapid strep came back positive.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yeah, she said it was. So she needs antibiotics?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: She does. How long has she had the sore throat?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Started yesterday. She woke up saying it hurt to swallow. And she had a fever last night, 102.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Any cough or runny nose?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: No, just the throat.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Classic strep presentation. Let me take a quick look at her throat.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Yep, tonsils are red and swollen with some white patches. Lymph nodes are a little tender. Definitely consistent with strep.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: What antibiotic does she need?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'm going to prescribe amoxicillin. She'll take it twice a day for ten days. It's important to finish the whole course even when she feels better.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Got it. Ten days, twice a day.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: She can go back to school 24 hours after starting the antibiotic, as long as she doesn't have a fever.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: When should she start feeling better?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Usually within 24 to 48 hours. For pain and fever, you can give Tylenol or Motrin. Popsicles and cold drinks can help soothe the throat too.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: What if she doesn't get better?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: If she's not improving after three days on the antibiotic, or if she gets worse, develops a rash, has trouble breathing or swallowing, or can't drink fluids, call us right away or go to the ER.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Should my other kids get tested? I have two more at home.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Only if they develop symptoms. We don't test or treat asymptomatic contacts. Just watch for sore throat or fever.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Okay. Anything else I need to do?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Get her a new toothbrush once she's been on antibiotics for 24 hours so she doesn't reinfect herself. And wash hands frequently to prevent spread.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: New toothbrush, got it. Thanks.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'll send the amoxicillin to your pharmacy now. Hope she feels better soon.
